Mount St. Marys University is a private, liberal arts, Catholic university in the Catoctin Mountains near historic Emmitsburg, Maryland, with a satellite campus for adult students in Frederick. Marylands second largest city.

patterns: Can you tell me about the Mount?
responses: Mount St. Marys University is a private, liberal arts, Catholic university in the Catoctin Mountains near historic Emmitsburg, Maryland, with a satellite campus for adult students in Frederick. Marylands second largest city.

Mount St. Mary's University is home to five campuses with traditional undergraduate programs, accelerated and adult undergraduate programs, graduate programs, Division I sports, Mount St. Mary's Seminary and the National Shrine Grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes.

Mount St. Mary's University's main campus is 1,400 tree-lined acres in scenic Emmitsburg, Maryland, and is home to all traditional undergraduate programs, several graduate programs, Division I sports, Mount St. Mary's Seminary and the National Shrine Grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes.

patterns: How many majors does the Mount offer?
How many minors does the Mount offer
What majors does the Mount have?
tell me about majors offered at the mount?
responses: The university offers more than 80 majors, minors, concentrations and special programs for traditional undergraduate students, and more than 25 adult undergraduate and graduate level programs. Learn more about Mount Academics by clicking the link shown above.
For undergraduate students, the Mount offers more than 80 majors, minors, concentrations, interdisciplinary and special programs. Learn more about Mount Academics by clicking the link shown above.

patterns: Can you tell me how to apply to the mount?
How can I come to apply to the mount?
responses: To be considered for admission, first-year students must complete a free online application using either the Mount Application or Common Application. If you have any questions about the application process, please let us know. And we highly encourage you to visit us or explore our online resources to learn more about our campus! Click the Admissions link above to learn more about applying!

patterns: How do I apply to the graduate school?
responses:
Interested in learning about admissions to our graduate schools. Go here for more information: 
 http://msmary.edu/admissions/graduate-admissions/graduate-students-admissions-faq.html

patterns: How do I apply as a transfer student?
How can I transfer from the Mount
responses:
If you are considering transferring into the Mount community, we are ready to show you everything Mount St. Marys University has to offer. Our team works hard to make it easy for you to make a seamless transition to the Mount, helping you with everything from transferring credits to course scheduling to assistance with financial aid. Find more information on how to apply as a transfer student here: 
 http://msmary.edu/admissions/undergraduate-admissions/transfer-students.html

patterns: How can I apply as an adult?
I am ready to come back to school
I am old but want to go to school
responses:
When you're ready to go back to school and earn your degree, the Mount team is ready to make it as easy and seamless as possible. We understand the challenges that come with balancing school with family and work, which is why we provide full support from one-on-one advising, to flexible and customized degree plans, to accelerated programs, and more. Learn more about our admissions process by clicking the admissions tab above or going here:
 http://msmary.edu/admissions/adult-undergraduate-admissions/adult-undergraduate-students.html

patterns: What is the Mounts Mission Statement?
Why should I come to the Mount!
responses: Mount St. Mary’s strives to graduate men and women who cultivate a mature spiritual life, who live by high intellectual and moral standards, who respect the dignity of other persons, who see and seek to resolve the problems facing humanity, and who commit themselves to live as responsible citizens.
As a Catholic university, Mount St. Mary’s graduate's ethical leaders who are inspired by a passion for learning and lead lives of significance in service to God and others.

patterns: How can I visit the Mount
Is there any way I can visit the Mount?
I want to schedule a visit
responses:
Just about every Mountaineer made a visit to campus before deciding to come here. To find more information on how you can visit our beautiful 1,400 acre campus, both in-person and virtually! Find out more information about schedule a visit here:
 http://msmary.edu/admissions/visit-campus/index.html

patterns: How can I get a Scholarship
responses: Mount St. Mary’s University is proud to make a dual commitment to students and families. The second part of our commitment is to make college as affordable as possible for students and their families. In addition to need-based aid, the university awards numerous academic scholarships ranging from $20,000 to full tuition. Understanding financial aid can be a challenge, go here for more information: http://msmary.edu/admissions/financial-aid/index.html

patterns: What activites can I do as a student at the Mount
what can I do in my free time
responses:
There are plenty of activities, sports, and games to keep you moving at the Mount. Learn more about how to get involved here!
 http://msmary.edu/campus-recreation/index.html

patterns: Tell me about clubs at the mount
Tell me how I can get involved
responses:
Getting involved is easy with over 70+ student societies, clubs and registered student organizations (RSOs) that fall in a broad range of interests. Pick an area of interest and see what speaks to you:
 http://msmary.edu/campus-life/get-involved/index.html

patterns: What sports are played at the Mount
Is the Mount a Division 1 School?
Can you tell me about Mount Athletics
what sports does the mount offer
responses:
We take athletics seriously around here. We like to run, jump, hit, dunk, lift, dive, throw and anything else that keeps us active and moving. Mountaineers compete in Division I athletics across 24 programs, as well as two premier sports. And each and every one of us is filled to the top with bona fide, blue and white, busting-at-the-seams Mount Maniac school spirit!. Learn more about Mount Athletics at the link below: 
 http://msmary.edu/athletics/index.html

patterns: What is it like living on campus
Can you tell me about campus life
responses: Living on campus is an exciting part of the traditional college experience that immerses you in learning more about yourself, the Mount culture around you and the role you will play as a leader within your community and abroad.

Surrounded by the Cactocin Mountains and the National Shrine Grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes, our small campus connects you in a way that is uniquely different from other colleges and univeristies in the area. Here at the Mount, you will have an opportunity to grow spiritually, academically, socially, and personally just from getting involved and actively participating in what the Mount has to offer.

Living on campus puts you right in the middle of everything  from campus activities to club meetings. You're close to classes for mornings when the alarm doesn't go off, close to the library for late night cram sessions, and just a trailwalk away from the Catoctin Mountains, which means its easy to find space to breathe and reflect.

patterns: Tell me about dorming at the mount
responses: As a prospective incoming student at the Mount, you will receive housing information as a part of your admissions and orientation package. First-year students, while encouraged are not required to live on campus. All full-time undergraduate students are eligible to live in university-owned housing; unless they are enrolled as a commuter. While we are not able to guarantee housing for graduate students; if available, housing options will be offered only after all undergraduate students have been assigned housing.
Students live on campus in traditional residence halls, suite-style housing, apartments or our University Cottages. Check out our housing options!

All students apply to live in general housing, which includes Sheridan Hall, Pangborn Hall, Bradley Hall and areas of the Terrace Complex. Some opt to be considered for placement in an Integrated Learning Living Community (ILLC), but those who do not are randomly assigned to a building with others in their class year.
